DOC.brief_summary: Context : Sirolimus-eluting-stents improve benefit percutaneous intervention native coronary artery reduce occurrence restenosis repeat revascularization , however saphenous vein graft always exclude form randomize trial . Objective : To evaluate angiographic clinical impact sirolimus-eluting-stents respect bare-metal-stents degenerate vein graft . Design : Double-blind randomized control non-industry-sponsored trial . Setting : A single-center tertiary-care referral hospital . Patients : All patient randomly allocate sirolimus-eluting-stent implantation correspond bare-metal-stent . All patient follow clinically repeat angiographic follow-up perform 6-months . Main outcome measure : Primary end-point 6-months angiographic in-stent late loss . Secondary end-points include : binary angiographic in-stent in-segment restenosis , intravascular-ultrasound-measured neo-intimal hyperplasia volume clinical event ( death , myocardial infarction , target-lesion target-vessel revascularization ) .
DOC.brief_title: RRISC Study : Reduction Restenosis In Saphenous Vein Grafts With Cypher Sirolimus-Eluting Stent .
DOC.criteria: 18 85 yearsold clear sign and/or symptom stable unstable angina document silent ischemia one denovo target lesion ( > 50 % diameter stenosis visual estimate ) localize one diseased SVG reference vessel diameter ( RVD ) include 2.5 4.0 mm ( visual estimate ) sign informed consent .
